definition: to lower/to decrease/to reduce/to subtract/to diminish

sentences.english: At the very least, that will make it hard for a future President to keep tax-cut promises.
sentences.chinese: 不管怎样，下一任总统将很难兑现他们减税的承诺。

sentences.english: The rule of absolution for taking pities on destitution was related to relieving the disaster and reducing farm taxes and excising taxes.
sentences.chinese: 蠲恤则例是指救灾扶荒与蠲减税赋方面的法规或准则。

sentences.english: They are often more comfortable and more durable than civilian clothes.
sentences.chinese: 还可以减税，制服更比素人装扮舒服和耐穿。

sentences.english: Even before the tax cut, hotel rooms are cheaper.
sentences.chinese: 即使在减税之前，酒店房间都比较便宜。

sentences.english: The proposed repeat of the corporate tax repatriation holiday is one such wolf in sheep's clothing.
sentences.chinese: 重提回流资金减税就是这种批着羊皮的狼。

sentences.english: Enterprises are entitled to tax cuts if employing invalids .
sentences.chinese: 雇用残疾人士的企业可以减税。

sentences.english: The bill will extend Bush-era tax cuts for another two years.
sentences.chinese: 该法案将把布什时代的减税政策延长两年。

sentences.english: He also attacks the Austria Pama's tax cut policy.
sentences.chinese: 他也抨击奥巴马的减税政策。

sentences.english: The president enounced his intention to reduce taxes.
You also get a tax deduction on your charitable donations.
sentences.chinese: 你同样能在慈善捐款上得到减税。

sentences.english: A tax cut is much easier to explain than a tax increase.
sentences.chinese: 减税远比增税要更得人心。

sentences.english: The President promised a $50 rebate for each taxpayer but failed to deliver it.
sentences.chinese: 总统曾答应让每个纳税人减税50美元，但未能兑现。

sentences.english: Most people plumped for lower taxes.
sentences.chinese: 绝大多数人绝对赞成减税。

sentences.english: That’s not bad since tax deductions are only good for one year.
sentences.chinese: 那并不太坏，因为减税的好处也仅能维持一年。

sentences.english: And it must bolster economic  growth by preserving tax cuts for our middle class.
sentences.chinese: 同时延续对中产阶级的减税也将支撑我们经济的增长。

sentences.english: Even with the tax cuts we are talking about.
